SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.io.console

Interface ConsoleWorker

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, IOWorker<String>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BufferedConsoleWorker
public interface ConsoleWorker extends IOWorker<String>
Interface for reading and writing data to and from the console.

Extends the IOWorker interface with methods tailored for console interactions, such as formatted output and multi-line writing.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
  • IOWorker

  • Method Details

    • writeln

      default void writeln(String data)
      Writes a line of data to the console, appending a newline character.
      Parameters:
      data - the string to write

    • writeln

      default void writeln(String... lines)
      Writes multiple lines of data to the console.

      Each string in the lines array is written on a new line.

      Parameters:
      lines - an array of strings to write

    • read

      default String read(String prompt)
      Reads input from the console with a prompt.

      Displays the specified prompt before waiting for input. The prompt is followed by a "❯ " symbol.

      Specified by:
      read in interface IOWorker<String>
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to display
      Returns:
      the input read from the console

    • writef

      default void writef(String format, Object... args)
      Writes formatted data to the console.

      Uses String.format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) to format the given string and arguments before writing.

      Parameters:
      format - the format string
      args - the arguments referenced by the format string
